data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly for Antitrust Violations
data.Description: A federal judge has ruled that Google holds an illegal monopoly in the search engine market, primarily due to its agreements with companies like Apple to be the default search provider. The ruling could have significant implications for Google's business practices and the future of digital advertising.

data.Title: Apple Rejects Bing as Default Search, Even for a King's Ransom
data.Description: Apple has emphatically stated that it would not replace Google with Bing as the default search engine on its devices, even if Microsoft offered the entire company. This highlights Google's dominance in the search market and Apple's satisfaction with the revenue generated through its partnership with Google.

data.Title: Google Local Service Ads Now Feature Photos
data.Description: Google Local Service Ads will now display photos from advertisers' profiles, potentially improving ad rank and visibility. This change aims to provide a more visually appealing and informative experience for users.

data.Title: Google Tests New "Short Videos" Tab in Search Results
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a new way to display more videos in search results. Instead of dynamically loading additional videos, clicking on "More Videos" might redirect users to a dedicated "Short Videos" tab.

data.Title: Google Ads API Version 17.1 Released
data.Description: Google has announced the release of Google Ads API version 17.1, introducing new features and updates for advertisers and developers.

data.Title: Google Search Testing "You May Like" Snippet Labels
data.Description: Google is experimenting with new labels in search result snippets, including a "You May Like" label that could indicate personalized recommendations based on user browsing history or preferences.

data.Title: Google Ads Issues Million-Dollar Credit Notices Due to Bug
data.Description: A technical glitch in Google Ads resulted in some advertisers receiving erroneous credit notices worth millions of dollars. Google has acknowledged the bug and is working to rectify the issue.

data.Title: Google Search Console Introduces Site Improvement Recommendations
data.Description: Google Search Console is rolling out a new feature that provides website owners with personalized recommendations for improving their site's performance in search results.

data.Title: Google Ads to Transition Smart Campaigns to Performance Max
data.Description: Google Ads will be migrating the functionality of Smart Campaigns into Performance Max campaigns in the coming months, providing advertisers with enhanced capabilities and a more streamlined experience.

data.Title: Apple Maintains a Massive Search Index
data.Description: Documents revealed in the Google antitrust case indicate that Apple maintains its own search index encompassing billions of websites, highlighting the company's potential to compete in the search market.
